text: Common mudpuppies (Necturus maculosus) are salamanders that live in streams, rivers and ponds. They hide in vegetation on the ground. They eat snails, worms and cray fish. They lay clutches of eggs. They are carnivores. They can grow up to and be as small as . There also one of the few salamanders that make sound the actually bark like dogs. They are also endanger from habitat loss. Category:Salamanders Category:Animals of North America Category:Carnivores
title: Common mudpuppy
